marketNews.title: Indonesian Economy Grew +5.03% YoY in 2024
marketNews.content: BPS notes that Indonesia's economic growth reached +5.02% YoY in Q424 (vs. Q324: +4.95% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation of +4.98% YoY. Quarterly, Indonesia's economic growth was +0.53% QoQ in Q424 (vs. Q324: +1.5% QoQ), lower than the consensus expectation of +0.56% QoQ. This result means that Indonesia's economic growth throughout 2024 only reached +5.03% YoY (vs. 2023: +5.05% YoY), lower than the government's target of +5.2% YoY and marking the lowest growth in the last 3 years, although it is still within Bank Indonesia's target range of +4.7-5.5% YoY. From the expenditure side, domestic consumption (+4.94% YoY vs. 2023: +4.82% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+4.61% YoY vs. 2023: +4.40% YoY) were the largest contributors to economic growth during 2024, contributing +2.6 percentage point and +1.43 percentage point, respectively. Meanwhile, net exports recorded a negative contribution of -0.01 percentage point due to an increase in imports (+7.95% YoY vs. 2023: +1.65% YoY) which was higher than export growth (+6.51% YoY vs. 2023: +1.32% YoY). Government consumption (+6.61% YoY vs. 2023: +2.95% YoY) contributed +0.48 percentage point, with the remaining contribution of +0.53 percentage point coming from other variables. Spatially, weaker economic growth was pressed by the Java and Sumatra regions, reaching only +4.92% YoY and +4.45% YoY in 2024, respectively, much lower than Maluku and Papua (+7.81% YoY), Sulawesi (+6.18% YoY), Bali and Nusa Tenggara (+5.04% YoY), and Kalimantan (+5.52% YoY). The release of 2024 economic growth data came just a few days after BPS announced that Indonesia's consumer price index inflation accelerated to 0.76% YoY in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 1.57% YoY inflation), well below the consensus expectation which predicted inflation at 1.88% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Amends Share Price for Private Placement to IDR 75/Share
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Darma Henwa announced that it has signed an amendment to the debt settlement agreement through a private placement from PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara and PT Andhesti Tungkas Pratama, where the new share price to be issued will increase from 65 rupiah per share to 75 rupiah per share. The amendment relates to the private placement plan of approximately 17.2 billion new shares to convert debt amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah, which will be taken by PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara and PT Andhesti Tungkas Pratama. DEWA stated that the company is also in discussions with one creditor who will participate in the private placement, although they did not provide further details.

tickerNews.title: BCA Confirms Customer Data Remains Safe Amid Ransomware Threat Targeting 4.9 Million Databases
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: EVP Corporate Communication & Social Responsibility of Bank Central Asia, Hera F. Haryn, stated to Katadata on Thursday (6/2) that they ensure customer data remains safe, amidst circulating rumors on social media X that a ransomware group is targeting 4.9 million BCA Mobile customer databases. Hera also stated that the issue is untrue.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Targets Over 75,000 Troy Ounce of Gold Production in 2025, Supported by Poboya Block 1
tickerNews.content: $BRMS: Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Herwin Wahyu Hidayat, stated that the company targets gold production of over 75,000 troy ounces during 2025, an increase of +36.4% YoY from the projected realized gold production in 2024 at 55,000 troy ounces (vs. 2024 gold production target: 35,000 troy ounces). Herwin said BRMS's production capacity in 2025-2028 will remain supported by the Poboya Block 1 in Palu, Central Sulawesi. Nevertheless, BRMS is studying the gold reserve potential from another block adjacent to the current production block. On the other hand, BRMS's gold production capacity will jump after the underground mining project in Palu begins operating in 2H27. BRMS is also finalizing a loan from banks of around 200-300 million US dollars for this project and will announce it in 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra Buys 500,000 PTRO Shares, Increasing Stake to 0.0729%
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea Commissioner, Erwin Ciputra, purchased 500,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 3,712 rupiah per share on February 3, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.86 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0679% to 0.0729%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Records IDR 7 Trillion Net Profit in 2024, Meeting 103% of Consensus FY24F Estimate
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in Q424 (+26% YoY, +11% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 7 trillion rupiah (+23% YoY), equivalent to 103% of the consensus FY24F estimate. On the top-line, revenue after profit sharing distribution grew to 5.1 trillion rupiah (+19% YoY, +9.6% QoQ) in Q424, so that for 2024 it rose to 18.6 trillion rupiah (+8.3% YoY). Meanwhile, other non-operational income increased by +34% YoY during 2024 and operational expenses swelled by +15% YoY. Provision expenses decreased by -25% YoY during 2024 along with the decrease in cost of credit (CoC) to 0.83%, marking the lowest level post-merger. Non-Performing Financing (NPF) also decreased to 1.9% in 2024 (vs. 2023: 2.1%). Throughout 2024, financing growth reached +15.9% YoY (vs. 2023: +15.7% YoY), with the financing growth target for 2025 remaining strong in the range of +14-16% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ELSA Targets 15% Net Profit Growth in 2025, Diversifying Portfolio to Non-Migas Segments
tickerNews.content: $ELSA: Manager of Corporate Communications Elnusa, Jayanty Oktavia Maulina, stated that the company targets a revenue increase of around +5% YoY in 2025, with a net profit growth target of around +15% YoY. Jayanty mentioned that ELSA sees the outlook for the oil and gas (migas) industry growing in 2025, driven by new investments and government programs aiming for energy self-sufficiency. Furthermore, ELSA will continue its business portfolio diversification strategy into the non-migas segment, especially by targeting upstream services such as seismic surveys for coal mining. ELSA itself will allocate its 2025 capex higher by +10% YoY (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 526 billion rupiah), with 44% of the total budget intended to strengthen upstream migas operational activities, 37% for the energy distribution and logistics segment, while the remainder will be allocated to new businesses, upstream support, and non-production projects.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Marketing Sales Reaches IDR 9.72 Trillion in 2024, Exceeding Target
tickerNews.content: $BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of 2.88 trillion rupiah in Q424 (+44% QoQ, +5% YoY). This result brought marketing sales throughout 2024 to 9.72 trillion rupiah (+2.3% YoY), slightly above (102%) the 2024 target of 9.5 trillion rupiah. The residential segment contributed 55.5% of total 2024 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (23.8%), gross commercial lots (8.2%), apartments (6.7%), and land plot sales to joint ventures (5.8%).

tickerNews.title: Controlling Shareholder and Director of AKRA Purchase Shares, Increasing Stake
tickerNews.content: $AKRA: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased approximately 10.2 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,107 rupiah per share between January 30 and February 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 11.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 63.64% to 63.69%. In a separate transaction, AKRA Director, Nery Polim, also purchased 85,000 AKRA shares at an average price of 1,120 rupiah per share on January 31, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 95.2 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Nery Polim's ownership in AKRA increased from 0.0084% to 0.0088%.

tickerNews.title: LPKR Marketing Sales Hits IDR 6.01 Trillion in 2024, Sets 2025 Target at IDR 6.25 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $LPKR: Lippo Karawaci recorded marketing sales of 6.01 trillion rupiah during 2024 (+17% YoY), surpassing (112%) the 2024 target of approximately 5.4 trillion rupiah. LPKR itself set a marketing sales target for 2025 of 6.25 trillion rupiah, which will be driven by new residential and commercial developments in Lippo Karawaci, Lippo Cikarang, and other areas within the company's landbank.

tickerNews.title: Philippine Senate President: Bill Banning Ore Exports May be Approved by June 2025; Indonesia Targets 220 Million Tons of Nickel Production in 2025
tickerNews.content: Philippine Senate President, Francis Escudero, stated on Thursday (6/2) that the Philippine Congress may ratify the bill banning exports of mineral ore - including nickel ore - as early as June 2025. The bill aims to ban the export of raw ore to boost the downstream mining industry, with the implementation of the new ban taking effect 5 years after the bill is signed to give miners time to build smelters. The Philippines is the world's second-largest supplier of nickel ore, with most of its exports going to China. The Chamber of Commerce of the Philippines and the Nickel Industry Association of the Philippines stated that a ban on mineral ore exports would cause mine closures and major disruptions to the existing supply chain, given that many mines have long-term contracts with international buyers. Director General of Minerals and Coal at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Tri Winarno, stated that the government targets nickel production of around 220 million tons in 2025, not significantly different from the Work Plan and Budget (RKAB) target for nickel production in 2024 of 240 million tons. Tri also mentioned that there are currently no concrete steps to cut the 2025 nickel production target, as the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is still in the evaluation stage.

tickerNews.title: C4ADS Report: Chinese Firms Control Around 75% of Indonesian Nickel Smelter Capacity as of 2023, Impacting Global EV Competition
tickerNews.content: The global security non-profit organization, C4ADS, reported that approximately 75% of nickel smelter capacity in Indonesia as of 2023 is controlled by Chinese companies. The report found that 2 Chinese companies, Tsingshan Holding Group and Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co. Ltd., controlled more than 70% of Indonesia's nickel smelter capacity in 2023, both being among the initial investors when Indonesia began pushing for domestic nickel downstreaming. C4ADS highlighted that the influence of Chinese companies in Indonesia's nickel smelter industry may limit Indonesia's ability to control and shape the industry for Indonesia's benefit. C4ADS also emphasized that dependence on China-controlled nickel production puts US and European car manufacturers at a disadvantage in the global electric vehicle market competition amid increasingly strict policies regarding trade with China.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Public Works: IKN Budget Blocked by Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Due to Efficiency Policy
tickerNews.content: Minister of Public Works, Dody Hanggodo, stated on Thursday (6/2) that the development of the Nusantara Capital City (IKN) had no progress because the budget was still blocked by the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani. The budget block is related to the budget efficiency policy, with Commission V of the DPR approving a cut in the budget for the Ministry of Public Works for 2025 from 81.38 trillion rupiah to only 29.57 trillion rupiah. Dody mentioned that a number of infrastructure projects are affected by this budget cut. Dody also said that he would report this adjustment to Sri Mulyani, and his ministry would recalculate its budget composition.

tickerNews.title: Health Minister: BPJS Kesehatan Premi Hike Calculated, Planned for 2026 Implementation Amid Rising Claim Potentials
tickerNews.content: Minister of Health, Budi Gunadi Sadikin, stated on Wednesday (5/2) that his ministry, along with the Ministry of Finance and BPJS Kesehatan, is calculating an increase in BPJS Kesehatan premiums, with the tariff adjustment planned to take effect in 2026. However, Budi could not specify the BPJS Kesehatan tariff increase. Budi explained that the premium hike discussion is not related to the implementation of the Standard Inpatient Class (KRIS) which will be implemented no later than June 30, 2025, but due to the potential increase in claims for heart disease, stroke, and other services. Previously, Director of Planning and Development of BPJS Kesehatan, Mahlil Ruby, said that program intensification according to the work plan and budget (RKA) could lead to a potential default in June 2026.

tickerNews.title: Foreign Investors Recorded US$12.5 Billion Net Sell in Asian Stocks in January 2025; Indonesia Sees US$229 Million Outflow
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that foreign investors recorded a net sell of US$12.5 billion in Asian stock markets during January 2025, comprising India, Taiwan, South Korea, Thailand, Indonesia, Vietnam, and the Philippines. Of this amount, foreign investors recorded a net sell of US$229 million from the Indonesian stock market in January 2025, marking a foreign outflow for 4 consecutive months. This foreign outflow trend was pressured by higher US government bond yields and increasing concerns over Asian countries' exports following additional import tariffs for China from US President Donald Trump.

tickerNews.title: US Services PMI Drops to 52.8 in January 2025, Driven by Bad Weather and Tariff Concerns
tickerNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management noted that the Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for the services sector in the US dropped to 52.8 in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 54), much lower than the forecast of 54.3. The Chair of the Institute for Supply Management Services Business Survey Committee, Steve Miller, said that many respondents highlighted severe weather conditions affecting business activity and production levels. Miller also mentioned that many respondents also mentioned preparation or concern regarding potential US government tariff actions, although only a few mentioned the impact on their current business.

tickerNews.title: Pandu Sjahrir of TOBA Rumored to Become Head at Danantara Sovereign Wealth Fund
tickerNews.content: Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait, signaled that the Deputy President Director of TBS Energi Utama ($TOBA), Pandu Sjahrir, will become a top figure at the Indonesian Sovereign Wealth Fund (Badan Pengelola Investasi Danantara). In a photo post on Instagram on Monday (3/2), Maruarar referred to Pandu as the 'boss of Danantara'. A source from Bisnis also said that Pandu will become Chief Operating Officer at Danantara, although Pandu has not commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: eFishery Investors Weigh Liquidation or Buyout Options Following Fraud Investigation
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that FTI Consulting Singapore Pte. - the advisor hired by eFishery investors to investigate the startup's financial reporting fraud case - recommended that investors immediately make a decision between liquidating or restructuring eFishery as soon as this month. Meanwhile, a workers' union organized by eFishery employees urged the company to cancel the mass layoff plan and continue its business.
